pageContext.claim: The Iran deal “leads to nuclear weapons for Iran in a short period of time.”
pageContext.analysis: None of the other international partners in the agreement, including key U.S. allies, would agree with this statement. The deal places a ten-year cap on research into enrichment technology and a 15 year cap on enrichment. After 25 years, the International Atomic Energy Agency would no longer monitor uranium production but Iran would need to continue to be in full compliance with the Non-Proliferation Treaty which restricts the development of nuclear weapons.
